question.text: The beam of light has three wavelengths $4144 Ã, 4972 Ã$ and $6216 Ã$ with a total intensity of $3.6 \times 10^{-3} \mathrm{Wm}^{2}$ equally distributed amongst the three wavelengths. The beam falls normally on the area $1 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}$ of a clean metallic surface of work function $2.3 \mathrm{eV}$. Assume that there is $\mathrm{n} 0$ loss of light by reflection and that each energetically capable photon ejects one electron. Calculate the number of photoelectrons liberated in $2 \mathrm{~s}$
